meanings.definition: A bract at the base of a spikelet in grasses and sedges.
meanings.sent1: The glume protected the seeds at the base of the grass.
meanings.sent2: The farmer examined the glume to identify the type of grass.
meanings.sent3: The glume seemed to be playing hide-and-seek with the tiny seeds.
meanings.sent4: Her hands felt like glumes, shielding the delicate flowers from harm.
meanings.sent5: The glume, like a tiny umbrella, shielded the seeds from the rain.

meanings.sent1: The glume on the wheat was dry and papery.
meanings.sent2: She brushed off the glume from the harvested grains.
meanings.sent3: The glume fluttered in the wind like a tiny flag.
meanings.sent4: His words were like glumes, covering up the truth with layers of deception.
meanings.sent5: The glume, like a protective armor, surrounded the grain with care.
